thread.title: Lemont football getting closer to South Suburban Blue title with win
thread.title_full: Lemont football getting closer to South Suburban Blue title with win

title: Lemont football getting closer to South Suburban Blue title with win
text:
Lemont football getting closer to South Suburban Blue title with win Published: Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 10:32 p.m. CDT By TIM CRONIN - Shaw Media Correspondent 
LEMONT â€“ Lemont took on undefeated Oak Forest on Friday night and defeated the Bengals, 35-0, marking the second straight shutout for the Indians. Related Links Plainfield North has no trouble with Romeoville 
That's only the half of it. 
If the Indians (7-1, 5-0) beat T.F. North next week, they win the South Suburban Blue outright and with it, the automatic bid to the playoffs. They're in already, as is Oak Forest (7-1, 4-1). There's the postseason seeding and pride involved in this, however. 
It was a thorough trouncing by the hosts in a series where the road team had won the previous five games. Lemont held Oak Forest to 89 yards and just 6 yards in the second half. The Bengals came into the game having scored 281 points and allowing only 107. 
The Indians jumped to a 21-0 lead with two touchdowns in the game's first six minutes and a third score in the second quarter. 
Jeremy Fejedelem bolted 19 yards off left end for the first score, capping a five-play drive 2:27 into the game. After Oak Forest's second straight three-and-out, the Indians made it 14-0 on Steven Fleming's 32-yard reception from Spencer Nagel midway through the quarter. 
Lemont made it a three-touchdown advantage on Nagel's 20-yard collaboration with a wide open Fejedelem with 2:36 left in the opening half. 
Jake Kirkman and Matt Dunne added rushing touchdowns in the second half.
